thread.title: Big Bear overwhelmed by 29 Palms
thread.title_full: FOOTBALL: Big Bear overwhelmed by 29 Palms - Press Enterprise

author: LANDON NEGRI
title: Big Bear overwhelmed by 29 Palms
text:
By LANDON NEGRI / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 17, 2015 8:21 p.m. BIG BEAR LAKE – It started bad, got worse, and just never got better.
Despite the best effort of Big Bear’s football team, the Bears just couldn’t buy a break, gain momentum, or really have anything go right Saturday afternoon, even on the friendly tundra of Big Bear Middle School.
Much of that had to do with Twentynine Palms, which got a 152-yard, three-touchdown performance from senior running back Beayahn Carrllo and four turnovers as the Wildcats dealt Big Bear a 49-0 loss.
Senior Donovan Esquilin added two scores as the Wildcats improved to 7-0 overall and 3-0 in the De Anza League with the win.
“They’re a very good football team, so take nothing away from them whatsoever,” Bears coach Dave Griffiths said. “We made just too many mistakes today.”
The Wildcats, ranked No. 3 in the CIF-Southern Section Northwest Division, kicked off to open the game but then recovered the ball – it was not a planned onside kick, coach Ernie Martinez said.
From there, Twentynine Palms kept up the pressure, forcing three Big Bear interceptions and a fumble. The Wildcats broke the game open with a 28-point second quarter and showed great balance, as Carrllo was complimented by a strong game from senior quarterback Jimmy Shragge , who completed 14 of 18 passes for 207 yards and two touchdowns.
“They looked forward to this game,” Martinez said of his players. “This is a big game. Last year, we had to win one of two with Big Bear and Shadow Hills to go to the playoffs, and we didn’t and we lost on a coin flip
“We knew we didn’t want to be in that situation again.”
Big Bear (4-3, 1-2) was held to 100 yards of total offense and did not get inside of the Twentynine Palms’ 30-yard-line.
“We’ve just got to regroup and come back,” Griffiths said. “We’ve got a young group of kids, and they never went away today. I’m proud of their effort.”
Contact the writer: lnegri@pe.com
